messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] growing pains?
messages.messageBody:
From: <starsuncloud@...>

<<I totally understand, it would be hard. But please, please, please don't
ever
say the "playing house" thing to her!! My mil said it once about dh and I
and
it really pissed me off.
They aren't "playing" at anything, they're having a relationship.>>



Fortunately Tara and I still talk a lot. I think I used that term in front
of her once when I was telling her about a conversation I had with her dad.
I was trying to get him to understand her. Total waste of time but I
digress. She understands that I know how she feels about this relationship.
They are in love and I understand that. She knows that. I never downplay
what she feels or does because of her age.

On a good note, her and her boyfriend are here tonight. I think she's trying
to break me in gently!!! LOL!!!
We finally got her title to her car today and Joe took her out driving on
the interstate and also tonight in "her" car. She's getting real excited and
I am so happy for her. She's been waiting so patiently for this to happen.
We're hoping the car will be done within the next month. Time for me to sort
out one of my birds flying farther.

Mary B

messages.subject: growing pains?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/2/2003 7:49:49 PM Central Daylight Time, ... I totally understand, it would be hard. But please, please, please don t ever say the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/2/2003 7:49:49 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> I think it's just the whole growing up
> playing house more frequently deal that has me feeling a bit, I don't know,
> maybe old??!

I totally understand, it would be hard. But please, please, please don't ever
say the "playing house" thing to her!! My mil said it once about dh and I and
it really pissed me off.
They aren't "playing" at anything, they're having a relationship.

Ren


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
